so that they can then make themselves better and they are and they're buying software like my company's got so they're gonna be more advanced than the actual financial companies themselves to be able to go and do those sort of analysis projects and things like that so you know it's it's a bit of a race against time at the moment but what we've found is with anti money laundering is that erm those that are involved they'll set up a shell company
mm

erm Geneva or the Cayman Islands or you know portugal anywhere but they won't do anything they won't trade in it for years three years four years maybe and then they start putting transactions through and they're laundering money through it and there's lots of steps in the transaction
cleaning the money

and what we're trying to do is we're trying to identify patterns in those steps so if a trade starts in Switzerland goes to a Swiss bank and ends in Switzerland it's probably safe but if the trade starts in Switzerland goes to the Cayman Islands and then goes back to I dunno Colombia then that should start ringing bells
mm
but not everybody looks at the whole the whole chain each bank looks at them and the next party who could be

but if you look at it as a whole

but if you look at the whole transaction you think mm that's why? why are they doing the transaction like that? so banks in all countries France Spain Portugal have relationships with another institution in another country and on the surface it looks fine and it probably is but you if you put all the pieces of the jigsaw together you start identifying what could be attempts to to move money around illegally

well I'm working on something at the moment which is similar in a way to what you do but not it is investigative but it's not fraud so I work for erm something called the British National Corpus and babasically what they do is part of my degree is studying languages and dia different dialects in England
yeah
so like you can tell I'm from the north and I can tell you're from the south it's just a way of speaking and the way
mm
that you use your tongue and pronounce things differently to how I do
mm
so like I'll erm drop Ts I'll drop words out of a sentence and stuff like that whereas people who are generally from the south don't normally do that they normally speak a proper sentence so to speak
do you want another beer?
oh no I'm fine thanks I've still got some left

erm and erm I I erm work for the British National Corpus collecting data erm and recording stuff with people talking so me and 'll have conversations and we'll record them and send them off to erm the person who's head of this project
yeah

and what they do is they put this erm recording through a piece of software that picks out words and picks out erm how dialects are different in different parts of the country and how things are pronounced
mm
so this British National Corpus is normally used for erm like language studies speech therapists erm all that like how language is used and what it's used for in what way
yeah
stuff like that so that's sort of a similar thing and it's
yeah
just collecting a lot of data and then finding out

it's what you do with the data after you've collected it really is the key thing and you know people have now are catching on to the fact that there's so much information out there if you can harness it you know you can do so much and learn so much that you couldn't see before you know cos most people work in isolation companies even if you work for a big bank and I've worked for a big bank my last firm was which is a big American bank they've got like twenty-eight thousand staff around the world paperwork in silos the banking industry's renowned for it you do your job in your department and you don't really know what's going on over there and over the years multiple computer systems have grown up because maybe they've acquired a company or they've developed something quickly and they end up with lots of databases of information no one ever gets the big picture and if they do it takes them months of management time
yeah and a lot of organisation

a lot of staff pulling data out and sticking it into spreadsheets and things like that so nobody really has a view what's going on across the company and they might have clients in here and clients over there and they're not using
yeah
that information
not using it
so there's so much more we can do and I think every sort of five or six years something new comes up in technology which
that allows it

are not related to what I'm doing in my day to day job so I think that

and that helps us decide where we should go shooting one in the morning and one in the afternoon usually erm and then depending on how many people there are we mark out posts around the area we're gonna be hunting so basically what happens is beaters go in with dogs flush the animals out and they come screaming out of somewhere and you shoot them as they go past sort of thing
